intro: Heliamphora elongata, commonly known as the elongated sun pitcher, is a carnivorous plant native to the tepuis of South America. It is characterized by its tall, slender pitchers that can reach up to 60 centimeters in height. The plant's pitchers are typically green or reddish in color and are adapted to trap and digest insects. It thrives in humid, nutrient-poor environments and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Heliamphora elongata is a popular specimen among carnivorous plant enthusiasts due to its striking appearance and unique ecological adaptations.
